answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.At least one-fourth of all myocardial infarctions are silent, without chest pain or other symptoms. They are discovered on EKGs. This is more common in diabetics, due to cardiovascular autonomic neuropathy. Therapy will now be based on the number of vessels blocked, the percentage of blockage and the viable myocardium which is present. Also, other factors like diabetes need to be controlled. Please discuss the options with the consulting physician.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: Interpretation: Extensive anterior lateral (and recent) inferior infarct. this ils a 64yr old female with no symtoms.
title: recent Ekg Interpretation
